metadata.title: runc: file descriptor leak (important)
metadata.description: DOCUMENTATION: A file descriptor leak issue was found in the runc package. While a user performs `O_CLOEXEC` all file descriptors before executing the container code, the file descriptor is open when performing `setcwd(2)`, which means that the reference can be kept alive in the container by configuring the working directory to be a path resolved through the file descriptor. The non-dumpable bit is unset after `execve`, meaning there are multiple ways to attack this other than bad configurations. The only way to defend against it entirely is to close all unneeded file descriptors.

criterions.comment: Red Hat Enterprise Linux 8 is installed
runc is signed with Red Hat redhatrelease2 key
Red Hat Enterprise Linux must be installed
